review_text: i decided to try out this liner because this is my friend’s all time fav eyeliner & i wanted to see what all the hype was about. after reading some reviews i realized that people either love this product or hate it. there were so many mixed reviews & i was skeptic about this product but now i see why people love this liner. it’s super affordable & it goes on really smooth. i also see why people dislike this product. it smudges easily & takes a while to fully dry but when weighing the pros & cons i feel like the pros outweigh the cons. as long as you don’t touch your eyes a lot & let it sit for a while after applying you’ll love this product!

review_title: Dark pigmened kaajal, superb for smudging!
review_text: Lakme kaajal - Black was the first kaajal that I layed my hands on (some twelve years back). It still remains one of my favorites and hence it is always in my vanity bag. The pigmentation of this one is to swoon on, deep black and because this tends to smudge after a little while and I prefer to use it on my lower lash line when I want a smudged look. The staying power is good at seven hours straight. It's non water-proof but isn't runny. Because of the deep pigmentation it's perfect for waterline application.

Good quantity last for up to 3 to 4 months
author: Divya Rai

review_text: Look, I've been using this kajal since the beginning of time, and I can't even remember how many pencils of this product I've finished. Even after using many products, this is the one kajal I keep coming back to. Pros: Really creamy. Very easy to use, and is retractable. You don't need to keep sharpening this. Stays for 3-4 hours straight. Slightly waterproof. VERY VERY BLACK. Cons: Not smudgeproof. This can easily be smudged if you have a habit of rubbing your eyes (like I do). This is the best formulation you're gonna get at this price.

review_text: I have recently bought two of the forever silk liner range, Blue Cosmos and Jaded Mint. I have worn the mint to work and it did not smudge at all on my oily lids throughout the day. Positives: 1. The range is certainly smudge proof. Once applied the product doesn't come off even if you rub your eyes. 2. Strong pigmentation. One stroke is enough. 3. No transfer to socket line :) Negatives: 1. It takes a lot of effort to remove it off the lids at the end of the day as its highly pigmented. 2. Slightly pricey compared to Maybelline.

review_title: Smudge proof, waterproof, moisturizing ceramids by Lakme
review_text: Inspired by the creamy vivid colours of gelato ice cream, Lakmé Absolute introduces Kohl Ultimate - The Gelato Collection. Turn heads with this range of 8 deliciously-hued eye pencils that look like eye candy - for real! These fresh pops of colour-on-a-stick are sure to reinvent the way you do your everyday makeup. Each pencil has a creamy consistency enriched with moisturising ceramides that glides effortlessly on your skin. Stay carefree about your makeup during work hours or party time as it is smudge-proof as well as waterproof. Get a rich colour payoff with these pigmented, super long wear shades. You can use this multi-purpose eye pencil by wearing it on your eyelid as a liner or blend it a little to add a subtle pop of colour to your eyes. We recommend applying 2 coats of mascara for a striking look. Available in 8 ice cream inspired shades - Raspberry, Matcha, Mandarino, Black Currant, Lagoon, Limoncello, Spearmint and Candy Floss. Dial up the fun and let your eyes do the talking with these ‘eye-catching’ shades! How to Use: Clean the area around your eyes. Draw a line from the inner corner of your upper eyelid, Pull down your lower lid to line under the eye! Smudge with your finger or a brush if desired.

product_title: Lakme Absolute Kohl Ultimate The Gelato Collection

review_text: Colour: 05 Lagoon Price I bought for: ?499 I was quite sceptical about the longevity and colour pay-off for this eye pencil but the colour was just so gorgeous I had to try it out! And thank goodness I did, because I'm in love with this pencil. The colour is intense just as shown in the pictures and it glides smoothly and stays put for a longg time without bleeding. I have an oily waterline, so every single black eye pencil I've tried will inevitably bleed under my waterline by the end of the day, only difference would be how much it bled. But, not this one! This one just stays put! No bleeding under the eyes (or at least it's not visible because of the colour ;) ) I only hope this formula is available in black or even brown for that matter. Only thing is, I have to go over a couple times to get the intense colour as shown in the images, but I do that with every eye pencil I've ever tried. Nothing is really ever one-stroke-application really. Since this eye pencil does not bleed, it has sort of become my everyday kajal. Love the pop of colour it provides. Makes my eyes look brighter! I love how I can pull off this particular colour as a daily look and for a party look as well!

author: Disha Jaggi
product_title: Lakme Absolute Kohl Ultimate The Gelato Collection

review_text: I had been planning to buy this product for a really long time now. After havung received the product, i have to say this is not what I was expecting. Given it's was an exclusive launch, a high end product like this should give some high end results too. It glides on smoothly on the skin. But the pigmentation is so poor, almost pathetic. With the kind of advertising the brand has been doing, they should at least do the minimum to love upto it. To their brand name. It is "kinda" smudge proof, but please don't expect a lot out of it. When buying a product like this, strictly speaking about the properties and application here, one expects something like this to come in handy with impromptu plans. When buying it for the color you expect a shade of pop to your eyes but the product fails to deliver any of those results. Please think twice before buying this. I am a woman in her 20s with an extremely pro active lifestyle. Ethically speaking, this is not worth the investment. This is not the go-to-product. The kind woman should actually want to invest in. A better purchase would be any other make up product, but this!

And then finally I ordered this for the 3rd time when I gave away the last one to a friend. This product had initially launched as a limited edition but I really hope that they keep manufacturing it. review_text: The Lakme Shimmer brick is a blush cum highlighter. It has 4 different shades in each palette and these look gorgeous on Indian skin. You can use this to add a cheeky glow to your face or even highlight your cheekbones using a fan brush. It instantly brightens up your face and gives you a beautiful radiant glow that lasts all day long. Its texture is smooth and the shimmer is finely-milled – it leaves you with a soft glow and a beautiful flushed look. This is a definite winner in the blush+highlighter department! Do give it a try.

Coming to packaging its very sleek and travel friendly, the only problem I haveis with cap its very fragile and breaks easily but it doesn't matter a lot. I love this product.

review_title: Good But Difficult To Match With Some Foundations
review_text: I bought this concelaer just as a trial in a departmental store, along with Lakme Absolute White Intense Skin Cover Foundation. I have not used it that often, but for parties and social functions. It is a nice product, but can look cakey and drying, if not applied with mosturizer. Recently I started using it with a brush after coating the brsitles with a light mosturizer. In that case, it blends perfectly. I don't remember the shade right now but I guess it is 01 Fair. It goes well with the foundation I purchased, but may look very white when applied with other foundations. Also, it is difficult to get a smooth look in the winters, and it can be very drying. So, extra mosturizing may be required. Once set, it covers the blemishes and even small acne; you just need to know how to apply.

review_text: Bought this in the shade sunkiss. It's a beautiful highlighter with very subtle golden brown tint to it. The product is beautiful esp for the price it is offered at. One point taken for the applicator though. The sponge is really soft but it's difficult to work with it on the face. The product gives a beautiful shine,is a glittery in a good way. Esp when the light hits the areas where its applied! Feel like a Goddess with that glow! U can use it as a body shimmer too for those spl occasions and parties. A great highlighter for all those of us on budget. PS: its says blush but really its a highlighter so if u lookin for a blushed this is not the right product for u. It's a pretty highlighter though!

product_title: Lakme 9to5 Primer + Matte Liquid Lip Color

review_text: Personally I'm in love with this colour since a decade. So I ordered it, this looks pretty nice on dusky skin tone like me. It'll look beautiful on fair skin undoubtedly. It enhances the lips and gives confidence. The texture is good, it's not at all tacky and feels very light on my lips. It's water proof definitely but can't withstand oil. So beware when you're eating some oily stuff. For the same reason one can't apply any moisturizer before application of this lip colour. The shade gets darker after it becomes dry. It lasts long if there's no oil touching it. One full coverage coating is enough, another coat will make it darker and ruin the shade.

author: debolina saha

review_text: Another pocket-friendly gem from Lakme. Somehow, I have realized their cheaper products are far better than their higher range ones, simply because these products at these prices are the best in their range. Coming to these glosses using them since college, which is quite some time back. I still always have in my purse. The strawberry one being my favourite, I also like the vanilla which adds a tad bit of brown which is my natural colour. But I don't use it regularly because of the shimmer. The glossy look it gives is amazing but it's a little too sticky so be careful about using too much. A little goes a long way. Also, this is a dust magnet so if you are going out on a two-wheeler or it's a windy day I suggest you apply this after this reaching where you have to.

review_text: This gloss provides sheen to the lips and does make them look more appealing, but the sheen tends to fade after a few hours and you can only feel the sticky gloss. It does not make the lips dry. I have used it over my coral lipsticks also and it gives just the perfect shine. The consistency of the gloss is on the thicker side.Coming to the fragrance, it actually smells of fresh strawberries and quite true to its name. Those of you who have the habit of licking the lips will eat away the entire gloss because of the sweet taste and the yummy fragrance. It does not have any shimmer in it, so can be worn during any point of time.Coming to the fragrance, it actually smells of fresh strawberries and quite true to its name. Those of you who have the habit of licking the lips will eat away the entire gloss because of the sweet taste and the yummy fragrance. It does not have any shimmer in it, so can be worn during any point of time. Pros of Lakme 1. It smells amazingly nice and has a sweet taste too. 2. Comes in a travel-friendly tube packaging. 3. Has a slant applicator which helps in better control of the application owing to lip contour.

Then the fact that any hair/sparkle/phool patte that stick to it are almost impossible to get off without smearing your makeup. All in all, it is not even an average passable product despite its cost so spend a little more money and skip this.

review_text: This is a product for those who love the retro glossy lip look. It took me back to the 90s instantly. I have the Vanilla shade of this lipgloss. It is really thick but not very tacky, it sits nicely on top of the lips and thus can be used as a lip topped. It has a bit of a sheen to it, it isn't extremely shiny and doesn't have chunky, cheap looking glitter in it. This product however, doesn't moisturize the lips. It in no way is a lip balm. If you like a light glossy look, you might want to give this lipgloss a pass. All in all, it is an amazing product for gloss lovers.

review_text: This lipstick is 'the' lipstick my mother has been using all her life. So, like all other daughters, mother's lipstick was the first lipstick I tried using. It is a conventional maroon shade which has been in the market since forever, and it deserves its loyal users. The color is actually quite versatile because it can be used as daily wear for work or for a get together with friends. Being a gorgeous maroon it can be worn with many colored clothes. Also, being highly pigmented, this shade covers any black marks or discoloration of the lips making them look smooth. It can be used in a very low maintenance way because the shade is nice and dark. This is perfect for women who don't invest too much time on their daily makeup. I of course gave this lipstick a 5/5 since I've been seeing it being used happily since childhood. Lovely product and Nykaa sends them very well packed and at a discounted price too! No reason not to buy!

review_text: Really amazing deep red shade. Unfortunately my camera couldn't pick up the deepness of the shade. But it's a very good liquid lipstick formulation by Maybelline. Let's look at some key lipstick parameters: COLOR: Deep red and suitable for all skin tones. Truly sublime. I am medium to dusky toned and you can see how good it looks on me. LONGETIVITY: Yes it is a long wear lipstick. It lasts for 5-6 hrs or even more(upto 9-10hrs) if maintained well. It does leave a stain also. I had oily food after the application and it didn't seem to budge. FORMULATION: Matte formulation but is not drying or chipping off like most other liquid lipsticks. PIGMENTATION: It is clear enough from my pics that it it's heavily pigmented and appears with a single layer of application. Good coverage. TRANSFERABLITY: Negiligibly, almost nill transfer. ODOUR: A sweet subtle odour, maybe like talc. Not irritating. QUANTITY: Good quantity as per price range and quality of lipstick APPLICATION: Easy to apply but requires some precision. Wand is good. Recommended? YES. Absolutely do go for it!
author: Hala

review_text: The product is superb and the shade lasts for 4-5 hours great for daily use. The price is reasonable as well. Also, a lot of colour options available and all are really great. The pigmentation is good as well. Also smells great which is a bonus. I would definitely buy it again.

review_title: Absolute creamy but not at all transfer proof

I feel that this lipstick is way too creamy and the name says it too, enrich satin but the only problem is that it is not transfer proof and as soon as you eat something of touch your lips, it will smudge and vanish like it was never there. So, think about the purpose of buying and then buy. But, for daily use at home its perfect.

review_text: This range is the lowest range from Lakme in terms of the price point. So, nothing extraordinary should be expected out of this collection. The silver plastic bullet packaging looks and feels really cheap. The color is a gorgeous purple shade. It has shimmer in it. Very good pigmentation and color payoff. It gives a buildable medium to full coverage. In one or two strokes it gives an opaque look to the lips. Smooth in application. Settles into a creamy, silky, satin finish. Its not smudge proof or waterproof. It might bleed also. Staying power is approximately 3-4 hours. Shelf life of this product is 3 years. Quantity and quality for this rate are pretty decent. I know a lot of people absolutely hate its smell, but I like it a lot. Overall if one is in budget and not really into makeup or are newbies to makeup, they can purchase this lip color.

review_text: SHADE - The shade appears to be brownish pink but when applied, it comes out as light Magenta. Applied colour doesn't have any hint of brown. It's not a warm colour.. Much like a cooler tint of pink. SUITABILITY : Although this shade can suit all Indian skin tones, but it better suits fairer tones. TEXTURE : As the name goes, the lipstick is smooth as satin. It just glides across the lips and feels very smooth and creamy when applied. It DOES NOT feel sticky or heavy on the lips. TRANSFER : It is not very long lasting and smudges easily. It transfers easily to any surface. About Nykaa : Before time delivery, good packaging. Most importantly, I got the product with a recent Mfg date. No old or nearing-expiry products.

review_text: I have it in several shades, one pink and one brown. One is creamy finish, while the other has a bit of shimmer making it frosty. the creamy pink color is rich and coats lips on 1st swipe making it look deliciously full. the frosty has poorer pigmentation, but i dont mind as it is beautiful in its color itself. very smart for office wear. Lakme enrich has some very nice colors for office wear. So pick browns according to skin tone.. Wear time is average. Lasts around 3 hours without eating or drinking on me. The new bullets are absolutely fab to look at and i dont mind re-applying. thank you lakme for changing the old boring casing!

Staying power is too low and not transfer-resistant at all. Very hydrating. Not sticky. Light fragrance. Doesn't bleed, can bleed minutely on oily skin. Packaging is good. Good value for money? Yes, since it's not very expensive. I wouldn't recommend this colour for very deep skin tones.

I will definitely recommend this to each one of you reading this review. So yes go and get your hands on this wonderful lipstick as soon as possible.

author: Sushma

review_text: Lakme Enrich Satin Lipstick comes in metallic body with transparent cap. The cap shuts tightly and would not easily open up in your handbag. The shade number is mentioned at the bottom of the tube (wish they had names). The packaging is uber cute and handy - I'm loving it! Thanks Lakme for hearing, I was really bored up with the usual burgundy one. The texture is very silky, moisturizing and glides easily on lips. The colors are pigmented enough to stain lips, hence long lasting. Although the lip color is soft and smooth it neither bleed outside the lip line nor accentuate dry flaky bits of lips. The color stays on my lips for good 5-6 hours with light meals, after which I applied my favorite Lakme Lip Love Care Balm in Strawberry on top and my lips appeared pinky again :) The lipstick smells of vanilla - which makes it more delicious. Lakme Enrich Satin Lip colors are hands down one of the best budget lipsticks available in India.

Fades unevenly.

Pros It has longer lasting properties. The product is quite affordable. It has an amazing texture. it has a buttery creamy finish with a little glossy shine to it, not making it a creamy matte. Cons The packaging is light and good in appearance This product is highly pigmented and with just a single swipe, it turns opaque. The staying power is really awesome.

review_text: So I have fair skin with yellow undertone. My skin is combination and I have pores and hiding those pores are challenge for me. I have used Maybelline, MAC, L.A. Girl and lakme and thus I am writing this review. MAC is amazing but you can't use it on daily basis as it is expensive. L.A. Girl is good but again the problem with L. A Girl foundation is that it has shelf life of only 6 months which again makes it expensive. Maybelline I don't know why it is so hyped about. I have used the Pore less foundation and with every primer be it Lakme, Colourbar, Nykaa it just doesn't work. Now coming to Lakme : Pro : 1. It's a drugstore brand and not much expensive. 2. It will hide your pores. No matter which brand primer you use, it will give you a nice coverage. But works best with Lakme primer. 3. It works well with combination skin, condition you need to moisturize your skin well. 4. The shelf life is pretty amazing Con: 1. This foundation is not for dark skin tones. Lakme doesn't cater much for deeper skin tones but slowly it has launched more shades in 9-5 range. Hopefully it will launch some more in this range as well. 2. If didn't moisturize your skin properly, it will make your skin fell dry and patchy specially for dry skin people.

review_text: I have never found a foundation better than this! As I have a fair skin tone with pink undertone, every other foundation that I have tried made my skin look too much with make up and looked very artificial. This foundation is like a second skin! it's very moisturizing and I love the smell. It will look good on people with dusky skin tone as well cos my cousin who has dusky skin tone bought the same shade and it looks excellent on her face too. I have dry skin and she has normal to oily skin and it's suiting both of our skin. So it's suitable for all skint type. Gives medium coverage and long lasting. Covers blemishes and skin looks smooth. Lastly it doesn't crease. Go for it girls!

review_title: All the above shades are perfect for Indian skin tones.
review_text: The foundation is quite flowy and liquidy and can actually drip if you hold the dropper upright without pressing the nozzle. I love the texture of this foundation and also the fact that it blends easily on your skin. Ivory Cream (01)- This shade is great for fair skin tones with yellow undertones. Rose Silk (02)- This shade is great for fair skin tones with pink undertones. Silk Golden (03)- This shade is similar to ivory cream but has a a bit more of the yellow undertones and will match fair-medium skin tones. Natural Light (04)- This shade is a dupe for NC 40 (I feel) which is a bit on fair side with yellow undertones. Honey Dew (05)- This particular shade will match most of the Indian medium skin tones. Both 04 and 05 suit me because of the prominent yellow undertones so I prefer mixing them both for a perfect shade match! 05 alone can look a bit dark (still wearable) and 04 has the perfect shade that keeps my complexion looking healthy, so mixing them both works for me. This shade will suit anyone who use NC 42 in MAC. Natural Almond (06)- This is a bit darker than 05 and has very prominent and visible yellow undertones. this shade should go well with medium-dark or dusky skin tones. Although, this can still look a bit yellowish or weird on very dark skin tones.

author: Prosenjit Biswas
product_title: Lakme Absolute Argan Oil Serum Foundation With SPF 45

review_text: The product is light to medium buildable coverage. You can have a sheer coverage with just one layer or you can layer 2 more times to build it up wherever you need more coverage. Since it is a very runny formula, please build it up slowly so that you are not left with uneven streaks or lines on the face. It is good for normal to dry skin which provides a beautiful natural glow to the skin. It has SPF 45 that is enough to protect skin from the sun. I prefer using a dense brush to get maximum effect. Since it is a dewy foundation it does transfer if you do not set it with loose powder or compact. This foundation does not oxidize on my skin at all. This foundation will not work well for extremely oily skin. Even if you have combination skin this foundation is not a good choice in very hot summer days when you are out in the sun or sweating a lot. This product will give you a nice glow and leave your skin dewy and healthy looking. But if you sweat a lot or produce too much oil, the foundation will wear off your skin easily and make you look more sweaty. Dry to normal skin beauties can use it any time of the year they want.

You dont even need a wet wipe to clean it. A dry fabric will do. So overall it is okay to use, if someone who is very cautious about their complexion and applies face powder. You can use this instead.
